intro: Campylocercum metzii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface. Campylocercum metzii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
